name: kreuzberg
description: A text extraction library supporting PDFs, images, office documents and more
readme_summary: Kreuzberg is a Python library providing an async interface for text extraction from diverse document formats.  It supports local processing without cloud dependencies, offering both async and sync APIs including batch processing for efficient text retrieval.  This is ideal for RAG applications and other scenarios needing robust, local text extraction.
key_features: Unified async interface for text extraction
Supports various document formats (PDF, images, office documents)
primary_use_case: Text extraction from documents for RAG (Retrieval Augmented Generation) applications

name: wild
description: A very fast linker for Linux
readme_summary: Wild is a linker designed for rapid compilation during development, especially beneficial for Rust projects on x86-64 Linux.  While not yet incremental, it offers speed improvements over other linkers for initial builds.  It supports various output formats and has been tested with many crates from crates.io.
key_features: Fast linking for iterative development (though not yet incremental)
primary_use_case: Faster build times during development of Rust code on x86-64 Linux systems

name: lume
description: A lightweight CLI and local API server to create, run and manage macOS and Linux virtual machines (VMs) natively on Apple Silicon.
readme_summary: Lume provides a command-line interface and API server to easily create, run, and manage virtual machines on Apple Silicon.  It leverages Apple's Virtualization.Framework for near-native performance and offers features like pre-built image support, configuration modification, and a local API server.  The tool supports both macOS and Linux VMs and can be installed via Homebrew.
key_features: Lightweight CLI and local API server for managing macOS and Linux VMs
Near-native performance on Apple Silicon using Apple's Virtualization.Framework
Create, run, manage, and delete VMs
API server for programmatic VM control
Support for sharing directories with VMs
primary_use_case: Creating, running, and managing macOS and Linux virtual machines on Apple Silicon with high performance.

name: autogram
description: AI agent that automates AI news curation and post to Instagram
readme_summary: AutoGram is an AI agent that automatically collects and filters AI & tech news, generates branded images, posts to Instagram, and analyzes performance.  It uses Python, Google Gemini, Replicate SANA, and various APIs to manage the entire process, learning and improving content selection over time.
primary_use_case: Automates AI news curation and Instagram content management

name: DeepSeekPin
description: This lightweight Chrome extension lets you pin and manage your most important Deepseek chats for improved productivity, keeping them easily accessible at the top of your sidebar so you never have to scroll through your chat history again.
readme_summary: This Chrome extension enhances chat management in Deepseek by allowing users to pin important conversations for quick access.  It features a simple user interface and is lightweight for seamless integration. The extension improves efficiency by eliminating the need to repeatedly search for specific chats.
key_features: Pin important chats for quick access
primary_use_case: Pinning chats in Deepseek for easy access

name: gridt
description: Gridt - A highly customizable CSS Grid overlay for web developers
readme_summary: Gridt is a customizable CSS grid overlay that allows developers to adjust various grid properties, attach it to different elements, and maintain its state during hot reloads.  It supports both even and uneven grids and offers options for visual customization.  The tool is designed to simplify the process of creating and managing grid-based layouts.
key_features: Customizable columns, rows, grid gaps, and outside margin
Attachment to window or HTML element via CSS selectors
Support for custom grid-template-columns/rows for uneven grids
Adjustable line color and stroke width
primary_use_case: Providing a customizable CSS grid overlay for web developers to aid in grid-based layout design.

name: python-magic
readme_summary: This Python library provides a wrapper around the libmagic library, enabling file type identification.  It offers functions to identify file types from files or buffers, supporting mime type detection and file uncompression.  Advanced options are available for direct control over the process, though not recommended for general use.
key_features: Option to uncompress files before identification
Direct control over magic database and character encoding detection (Magic class)
Error handling for various scenarios including mismatched library versions and incorrect magic file paths
primary_use_case: Identifying file types based on their content
